body: I will investigate the failures.

Refer to this link for build results (access rights to CI server needed): 
https://builds.apache.org/job/kafka-pr-jdk8-scala2.12/5011/
Test PASSed (JDK 8 and Scala 2.12).

@hachikuji @ijuma I have integrated batch record count checks into the `DefaultRecordBatch.RecordIterator` and added header count checks for `DefaultRecord`. Would be great if you could take a look at it.
sorry guys but thank you @ijuma

Patch looks good to me.

The Admin client test failure seems to be because you compared a buffer with a list:
```
kafka.api.SaslSslAdminClientIntegrationTest > testCreateDeleteTopics FAILED
    java.lang.AssertionError: expected:<List(2, 0)> but was:<Buffer(localhost:35186 (id: 2 rack: null), localhost:36275 (id: 0 rack: null))>
```

Not sure about the TransactionsTest failure, might not be related to this patch.

Thanks for the patch. I wonder if we can make this mechanism more general and allow any test case to provide custom logging overrides. For example, we can add a "loggers" variable to the environment and let the template iterate over them.

@hachikuji @ijuma I have managed to fix the bug in the headers check and also hopefully sorted out the issue with checking for bytes left at the end of the batch - my approach is via additional `read()` call for the stream case, as was kindly suggested in the JDK ticket that was linked to the case you highlighted ( http://bugs.java.com/bugdatabase/view_bug.do?bug_id=7031075 ).

Let's do that in a following PR, especially since this seems to be the first need for this. 

Also, we need these logs to debug any transactions test failure, so it's best to get this in early. 

> On Jun 7, 2017, at 14:56, hachikuji <notifications@github.com> wrote:
> 
> Thanks for the patch. I wonder if we can make this mechanism more general and allow any test case to provide custom logging overrides. For example, we can add a "loggers" variable to the environment and let the template iterate over them.
> 
> —
> You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or mute the thread.
>
Merged to trunk and 0.11.0 after a few Scala style fixes.
Can you please fix checkstyle errors? It would be good to run checkstyle locally before opening the PR. :)
Addressed the review comment and fixed the failing test. Will merge after the build passes since the changes were minimal since the review.

For now, I change the name of the template variable to `producer_internals_log_level`. This is more general and can be used in other tests without confusion. Also, I don't think adding `consumer_internals` and something similar would be too big a deal. After all how many modules would we realistically want to turn on individually that it merits a more general solution?
